title: Services under the Union and the States (Part XIV of the Indian Constitution)

information.title: Constitutional Provisions
information.description: Part XIV of the Constitution (Articles 308-323) deals with Services under the Union and the States. It provides for the regulation of recruitment and conditions of service of persons appointed to public services.

information.title: All India Services
information.description: These are common to the Union and the States, including the Indian Administrative Service (IAS), Indian Police Service (IPS), and Indian Forest Service (IFS). They are recruited by the Union but serve under both Union and State governments.

information.title: Central Services
information.description: These are services under the Union Government, categorized into Group A, B, C, and D. Examples include Indian Foreign Service, Indian Revenue Service, etc.

information.title: State Services
information.description: These are services under the State Governments, also typically categorized into groups. They include services like State Civil Service, State Police Service, etc.

information.title: Public Service Commissions
information.description: Article 315 provides for the establishment of Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) for the Union and a State Public Service Commission for each State. These bodies conduct examinations for appointments to the services.

information.title: Tenure of Office
information.description: Article 310 states that members of civil services hold office during the pleasure of the President or the Governor, as the case may be. However, this is subject to constitutional safeguards under Article 311.

information.title: Safeguards
information.description: Article 311 provides two important safeguards: (1) A civil servant cannot be dismissed or removed by an authority subordinate to the appointing authority. (2) No civil servant can be dismissed, removed, or reduced in rank without an inquiry.

information.title: Reservation in Services
information.description: Article 16(4) allows the State to make provisions for reservation in appointments in favor of backward classes of citizens which are not adequately represented in the services.
